page.title: 14Graham's Hotel
page.content: In Brixton there are many large, old houses like Brixton Lodge, Barnwell House, Elbridge, Cloudsleigh and Brixton House. One big house is now Grahams Hotel and Restaurant. It was built of granite in the colonial style in 1903 for the Moon family who owned music shops in Plymouth. It has a slate roof and a veranda, and four false windows to avoid window tax. The house was once used as the vicarage. Now it sleeps sixteen guests. The garden is about an acre including a tennis court. Mr.and Mrs.Lanning built their modern house between the hotel and the old coach house. The one room, stone outbuilding is where the gardener once lived.
